website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-range workshop with delightful features. If your child is a passionate carpenter or handyman or you're looking for a single product that siblings and friends can enjoy together, this deluxe workshop is a worthwhile investment.
pros: Detailed appearance is appealing, especially for older kids
Interlocking Durafoam blocks can be used to construct multiple projects
Comes with fun accessories including a battery operated drill with screws, nuts, and other essential tools
Functioning overhead light and pretend vacuum are a nice touch
Durable, with room for kids to grow
cons: Although it's cute, the toy vacuum doesn’t have a sound feature

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously difficult assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy Melissa and Doug. My husband, an engineer, and I have assembled many toys. This is the worst! Minimum directions, all pix. Black and white pix, parts are labeled by letter in the parts diagram, but not in each step pic. Hard to follow. Plastic parts do not fit together well. Holes don’t line up with each other. My husband had to use a pipe clamp to get top and bottom to fit together well enough to put screws in. Its very cute and I am sure my grandkids will love it, but I don’t think I will buy any more Step2 toys that require assembly.
customer_reviews.author: grey ann

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: My baby boy is only 1 year old but he has been trying to use random stuff to pretend screw his toys, he loves this thing. He can't play with everything on it yet and I did hide the small parts from him just to be on the safe side but this will grow with him. He plays with the screws and the tools and the vacuum. I do like the fact that the drill actually works with the screws but too bad the vaccum makes no sounds...anyhow...very cool toy.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka A.

customer_reviews.title: Will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his first birthday and he likes it, he's probably still a bit young and will grow into it which will be nice but he loves the tools. The drill is electric and because he's little and doesn't understand he often holds the bit still while holding it on but it must have a special feature for that kind of thing because it hasn't broken yet! Took a bit of putting together but not too hard. I threw away the instructions on how to make the things out of the 'wood' pieces and can't find replacement instructions for those anywhere! It's not obvious how to put them together so make sure you hold onto those.
customer_reviews.author: High-Klass

customer_reviews.title: Good toy, not a great hit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my boys several years ago. They are now 3 and 6, and still play with it from time to time, although I would say the 3 year old gets the most use out of it. Some of the tools are a little cheaply made, however, and have broken. I really thought the little foam "wood" pieces that you can put together were clever! My oldest boy put all the projects together the first day we had it, and then lost interest. It would be a little better if they had more options and pieces to build other things. I was hoping this toy would be a bigger hit than it actually was.
customer_reviews.author: pepperlarue

customer_reviews.title: It was easy enough to put together however
customer_reviews.text: It is very cute and my son absolutely loves it!!! It was easy enough to put together however.it looks like it comes with more "wood " than it really does .the same with the nuts and bolts. The bins look like they have been smashed.you can see the stress in the plastic. The black plastic backing also was bent in half.and the top has a gash in it. But besides that it is good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love product, not so fun assembly - but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's second birthday. He loves loves loves it, so do his sisters! He constantly is asking me to build his bird house. So cute, he feels just like daddy and pop pop. As far as putting it together - it seems easy enough, but some of the screw holes are nonexistent and so require some oomph putting it together. I'm 5' 3" 100 pounds and was able to do it without too much difficulty. It took a few hours to put together but that was only because my son kept trying to play with it while I was building and pushing me out of the way :)
customer_reviews.author: pxiedust

customer_reviews.title: Could not find a better work bench for price
customer_reviews.text: Could not find a better work bench for price. I thought the vacuum was big enough to put bolts down....I was wrong, I also though there were there pull out drawers on the bottom right....it is a door with stickers that look like drawers. Regardless I love this thing and so does my son but was just a little misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdixiecake

customer_reviews.title: the number listed to call is only normal business hours so when you have a very excited 4 year old and it got delivered at 8pm on Friday night you are pretty much screwed by missing parts of it and can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts, the number listed to call is only normal business hours so when you have a very excited 4 year old and it got delivered at 8pm on Friday night you are pretty much screwed by missing parts of it and can't get anything done about it for a few days that's very annoying. Not to mention minimal adult assembly is not accurate and the instructions are not easy to follow or comprehensive at all. Very let down and disappointed and I bought it on sale, god forbid I had actually paid the full $140 it was originally listed at, livid enough as is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken piece and ill fitting part on the vacuum portion. But overall, a nice play bench.
customer_reviews.text: There was a broken piece in the unopened box. The vacuum end piece had a big part broken on it. Also, the vacuum hose didn't fit properly on the main body. The part on the body had to be filed quite a bit in order to fit the hose on it. It was a Christmas gift so the parnets had to contact the manufacturer to request a replacement part. Haven't heard yet if the part was shipped to them. The father filed the fitting on the workshop to make the vacuum hose fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 3yr old boy
customer_reviews.text: Got my 3yr old son this for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. There were some reviews complaining about some of the features of this but to a toddler, I don't think it matters. He loves the light and the little compartments to hide his tools. Definitely worth the money. He will get a lot of use out of this- uses it every day
customer_reviews.author: LiZo

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy, annoying to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it BUT WHAT A PAIN IT WAS TO ASSEMBLE ! The holes are not pre made. You have to tear in to the hard plastic as you screw in the screws, and the parts are kind of clumsy, so you have to hold them together tight with one hand/elbow/forearm/small child, and screw in the screws. I should've probably used a power tool...but I'm a mom and I would've probably messed something up with a power drill. Nonetheless, my son loves this thing, A LOT.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: So cute.
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest set ever! My grandson absolutely loves it and it allows for a lot of dramatic play and creativity. It comes with heavy foam wood pieces with predrilled holes for building whatever they imagine. He and his dad love building things together.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: The building blocks are pretty cool and comes with plans for a few items ...
customer_reviews.text: So far my 3 year old loves it! The building blocks are pretty cool and comes with plans for a few items (a bird house, a boat, a car and a plane). The vacuum is basically all pretend, meaning that it doesn't make sound or actually vacuum, so my kid doesn't really care about that "feature."
customer_reviews.author: JenDC24

customer_reviews.title: awesome, but wish the hooks held better
customer_reviews.text: I looked at all the other work benches and decided on this one because of the working light and the pretend shop vac. I am glad I made the choice. The kids love both features (I have had to break up many fights on who gets to use the shop vac, but that only means they love it). I do wish the hose would stay on it's hook better, it doesnt grasp well. and that the peg board hooks for tools also hooked better. the tools fall off too easily so they end up not using the peg board.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybugturtle

customer_reviews.title: Step2 Deluxe Workshop
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it! I did most of the assembly and although there were 3 steps that it was a bit difficult to get the pieces to line up properly before attaching them, it only took about 45 minutes. My grandson (3) helped. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, because the 'pegs' or tool hangers, do not hold the tools, they fall off immediately. Alex is very particular about putting things where they belong, so he was quite frustrated when the hammer, screwdriver etc. kept falling when he tried to hang them. He plays with it just about every day and uses the workbench to 'repair' other toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kris M, Millville, PA

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this workshop is in the description. Our child is two years old and loved it even before it was out of the box. The colors make you think of Home Depot which helped because this kid gets excited to go to Home Depot. The tools all look like Dads which I believe he thinks they are just another set of Dads tools only for him. The side vac is the only disappointment We wanted the Fisher Price Workbench but that wasn't available anywhere. We do not regret purchasing this Step2 Workshop instead because our child has not stopped playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: ktuekert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift, my son fell in love with it at first sight!
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his 2nd Bday and fell in love with it. He is very picky about his toys, but this workshop keeps him interested and busy. He loves everything about it: the screws, the WORKING drill. Like many say, I would love for the vacuum to produce some noise to make it look real. My boy loves to vacuum, and this is one thing he (I think) he's missing about the kit. He loves the number of boxes and shelves for the 'wooden' parts and screws. Gosh, I'm a mom but I'd love to play such boys' toys!!!! Quite easy to assemble. Quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. Both my kids love it. Easy to assemble. I did it by myself and i am in no way "handy." Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The screws and tools don't really work that great. The vacuum cleaner doesn't make noise either. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!  Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my two year old nephew for christmas, and he is obsessed with it! We had to hide it after we assembled it because our kids would not leave it alone! lol. There is a light that you turn on at the top which is adorable, and if you put pieces into the vacuum they actually go down the hose and into the little cabinet, very fun! Plus it comes with faux wood pieces so that you can build little cars, it's adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Brown

customer_reviews.title: I was sad it was a Christmas present for my 3 year ...
customer_reviews.text: box came and was missing decals plus had a large side piece missing..I was sad it was a Christmas present for my 3 year old grandson. I called step 2 company . the lady I worked with was very pleasant. She sent me what I needed . My grandson has his gift now and loves it. Made me disgusted that a new toy would have missing pieces and a damaged one also. thank you to step 2 customer service person, Rose
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great work bench for my son
customer_reviews.text: Great work bench for my son. It's big enough for 2 toddlers to stand in front and play together and even more to move around it. Durable for my rough little guy and provides great storage for much more than the accessories included
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons love this tool bench! Plenty for them to keep busy with, perfect height and easy for them to manage!! Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: My son really likes this deluxe workshop, but it ...
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this deluxe workshop, but it was missing pieces. The peg board that holds the tools and all the "real wood" pieces were missing. The description stated new/damaged box, but if the description would have said missing pieces I wouldn't have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: CA lady

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for a rough and tumble boy.
customer_reviews.text: So far we have made the car, birdhouse, boat, birhouse, car, birdhouse, boat, birdhouse....he likes the birdhouse. He has rearranged his tools and supplies several times trying do decide how he is going to organize his space. It is his, all his, and he is very proud. He has hammered and sawed and loved to squeeze stuff in the vise. He was a little disappointed that the "drawers" weren't drawers, but a cabinet, but then he found his light and got over it. Overall a good toy. There would be minor adjustments if I were to redesign, but generally a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JP Floyd

customer_reviews.title: the kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to put together....if you have a drill. Don't try to use a handheld screwdriver! Getting through the plastic is tough with a handheld. But easy to put together. And the kid LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Ciana

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Now he can pretend to help daddy work on his cars
customer_reviews.author: James Avon

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for multiple ages
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toy for our one year old and our four and a half year old to share. They both loved it! There are small pieces so the one year old definitely requires supervision and should not be left to play independently. There are features that appeal to each age group. My husband spent approximately one hour assembling it. He is extremely handy and commented that a power drill is really a must for assembling. While it can be put together without one, it is much easier with it! There are stickers to put on as part of the assembly so be prepared for that, too. All in all, great toy and a big hit with my two boys!
customer_reviews.author: momoftwo

customer_reviews.title: better than most
customer_reviews.text: My grandson likes to play with workshop, but easily bored, as there are few activities to keep him interested. Perhaps activity that requires screwing items in workbench. the vacuum could make noise. My grandson is 5, so perhaps the toy was just too simple; I could see him more involved when he was 3-4 yrs, old all in all it is a sturdy item,.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing workshop for my 2 year old son
customer_reviews.text: Amazing workshop for my 2 year old son! He loves that the screw driver actually works, and that he can turn the light over head on and off! The vacuum is also a big hit! It is also a great price, some of the other nice workshops are almost 200$! Over all I highly recommend this, pretty easy to put together as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bay

customer_reviews.title: nice workbench
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 3-year-old boy b'day and all the kids at the party (2 yrs - 8 yrs) were playing with it. 3 year-old LOVES the light above the bench, the bolts & nuts, the drill with spinning bit & sound, and standing on the workbench. He is a normal rough boy - bang, boom. We've had it 2 months and nothing has broken or needed modifying or needed reinforced. He has not been interested in the faux wood pieces or projects, but I think that will come in time. I cannot speak for assembly because the grandparents did that, but they did not complain or comment about it. Nice toy to have.
customer_reviews.author: ChickB

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a future woodworker
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Our 5 year old enjoys a lot. Longer to put together then we thought but once done very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Jaryn R.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy with compartments
customer_reviews.text: the compartments are a hit with my 3 yr old, as is the vacuum hose. but all the fiddly bits are not interesting to him (bolts and washers, and all the soft foam shapes that can be put together to make something). He mainly like to hammer on it, and fill the compartments with all his toys. He would probably be happier with a kitchen stove/sink set that had even more compartments and containers.
customer_reviews.author: K. Weng

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Yes everything was there and undamaged, nothing fit wrong or anything like that. I just feel like I paid too much. We had a hard time trying to figure out how to put the foam pieces together. I would rate this a 10 but, I feel like this is really only worth $50-75.
customer_reviews.author: justin bruton

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Some of the pieces were a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Some of the pieces were a little hard to put together but it was manageable with two people at those moments. The screws seem too small for the holes on the workbench but need to play around with it further. Despite the vacuum not making noise and people's unfavorable review of that, my son manages to use his imagination and make vacuum sounds.
customer_reviews.author: stitchchick

customer_reviews.title: A challenging assembly but very nice when done
customer_reviews.text: A challenging assembly but very nice when done. Good service, replaced one broken part and sent several extras. Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.author: James Spad

customer_reviews.title: Have a friend help you
customer_reviews.text: The instructions took a minute to figure out all the nice to have a video link or something but other than that I went together pretty good it does take 2 people and my boys love it
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Great Workshop
customer_reviews.text: The Step2 Deluxe Workshop Playset is a hit with my toddler. The details are great for play and imagination. The top of the workshop has a puncture, but for convenience we have not contacted the company to exchange. Package arrived on-time.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle V.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Playset for Young Kids
customer_reviews.text: We love this playset. We bought this for our 2 yr old, and he handles the tools very well. The ease of assembly was moderate. However, it will take some patience and logic since you are working mostly off of diagrams. Not all of our holes were pre-cut, so we found keeping a drill handy was helpful. Storage is sufficient for what comes with the set making for easy clean up after playtime.
customer_reviews.author: JArnold

customer_reviews.title: Nice imagination toy
customer_reviews.text: Grandson likes it, however did not keep his attention for more than 20 minutes. Would have been great with more sound effects (shop vacuum)
customer_reviews.author: DeW

customer_reviews.title: My boys absolutely LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I recently put together a toy room for my boys, ages 8 and 2. This specific model won me over because it is bog enough for my 8yo to play but small enough for my (almost) 2yo to play as well. They have spent hours upon hours working in their "shop" and it warns my heart that they love it so much. Very proud of my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Ballenger

customer_reviews.title: My 21 month old twins love it
customer_reviews.text: My 2 boys love this and so does my 5 year old daughter. They love all of the places to put stuff and have even played with the vacuum, although it does seem a little odd to have it included on the set. It was pretty easy to put together, even though some sections of the instructions were missing words and we ended up putting the drawer in backwards I think. Still a great item!
customer_reviews.author: MissyM

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with this
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this. I bought it for my almost two year old. It has lots of detail and is just the right size. He loves the working light. The blocks are a soft foam that look like wood. Very pleased with the price of this unit and the quality. There is a little assembly required.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy M

customer_reviews.title: This would’ve been fine had it arrived damage free
customer_reviews.text: This would’ve been fine had it arrived damage free. Parts of the plastic were bent beyond repair and some holes didn’t line up for screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend them adding a level and tape measure
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves it. I bought it for her for Christmas (2017) and my brother says she plays on it all the time. I would recommend them adding a level and tape measure. I bought her both for her birthday to add to the set.
customer_reviews.author: Corine Kay Laumer

customer_reviews.title: This is built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, still going strong 4 years later. Our little manly man loves it. The stickers are kind of pain to put on but take your time because they come out great! totally worth the price tag. This is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Still fun for an almost 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my son, fully understanding that he tires easily of larger toys that have one real purpose. I am happy to say that 5 months later, he still runs over to the workbench and begins "building" things. My only caution (more common sense, but still caution) is that the screws and bolts are easily swallowed. I took them away for a while because he was putting them in his mouth. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kim C

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2 year old son's big item for Christmas. It is adorable and he plays with it all the time (we did add some additional "motorized" tools). I looked at other places for the "perfect" workshop for him but the prices and/or quality of most kitchens were terrible. As usual Amazon came through for me with a wonderful price on a great quality item!
customer_reviews.author: sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Not enough bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: Not enough bells and whistles..my grandson loves it but not enough working parts.
customer_reviews.author: Mick57

customer_reviews.title: I love this work bench for my son
customer_reviews.text: I love this work bench for my son! It even has a working overhead light! So cute and I love the foam wooden pieces for building projects! I can't wait to play Legos with my son but he's too young right now so for now, this will hold me over.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and my kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and my kid loves it. He received it for his 3rd birthday and I think that's a great age.
customer_reviews.author: Thea

customer_reviews.title: 2 yo loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 yr old grandson. He plays with it a lot. He likes fixing things.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Neat Work Bench
customer_reviews.text: My son got this work bench set for Christmas and he loves it. He stands and plays with it a lot. The tools are a good size and durable and he enjoys the electronic drill. The "wood" pieces are actually a type of foam and I haven't even given them to him to play with yet, because he is still very rough with toys and would probably have them shredded in no time. However, the rest of the toy is extremely durable and withstands him crawling and climbing all over it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great workbench for our son
customer_reviews.text: My 2.9 year old son loves this workbench. Only thing I wish is that the vacuum made a noise. Otherwise great product- so glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Lots of Fun and Imagination
customer_reviews.text: This play set was another perfect gift for my 2 1/2 y/o grandson. He loves to pretend and play with all of the tools. I also bought him a play tape measure and hard hat, which adds to the fun. It was easy for us to assemble, and the quality and durability of the products seems very good.
customer_reviews.author: MMC07

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble and is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and is very sturdy. Lots of "gadgets" for the children to play with and enjoy! The best part is that my little boy loved it! He will play for an hour and not be bored, I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Gina R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assemble and the quality expected from Little Tykes
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grandson loves it. Easy assemble and the quality expected from Little Tykes.
customer_reviews.author: g3tan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, good price too.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 4 year old nephew. He loves it. Hope he will get many years of use out of it. Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 3 year old. He's all boy so he's rough, tough and plays hard. I've had no issues with the workshop. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: A great workbench for little kids
customer_reviews.text: My little guy is only 14 months old, but he loves his workbench. Of course, we haven't given him all the little parts to play with yet. We put all his current toys in the drawers and cabinets of the workbench, and he loves opening the drawers and cabinets to get out his toys. The reason we got the bench was to help him get use to standing and feel comfortable on his feet. He spends a lot of time standing by the bench and playing with his toys. We definitely recommend this workshop/workbench.
customer_reviews.author: Nehal Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It is a great toy! has all the blocks and materials. It is easy to put together. I have put together alot of kids toys for my godkids, and this was easy. Alot better than the kitchen i got my goddaughter LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, no issues, it does come in a large box so be prepared, as always the outside box was a plain brown box which was great because it a gift. Even with the large size I was worried it would arrive late, but it did not it was on time with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy because a child can enjoy it for years. I got it for 2 year-old grandson. At first, there are small pieces that have to be saved for a later date, but, little by little, they can be added and I think a child up to 4 or 5 would still enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee1175

customer_reviews.title: Assembly revealed lesser quality
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was difficult as the plastic had NO HOLES where many screws were supposed to go. If holes had been prepunched, it would not have made much of a difference as the plastic sections being screwed together were hollow. It is not as sturdy as I had hoped and I purchased it for a classroom expecting high usage... hope it lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Loia

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This Toya is amazing and the quality is terrific. My little boy is four years old and it fits him perfectly. Many many hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Tonozzi

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my 2.5 yrs old son as a Christmas present. He is in love with it and regularly plays "shop". It has plenty of storage space for him to store all of his other tools. We are waiting to give him the pretend wooden pieces until he is a little older.
customer_reviews.author: mcabbie

customer_reviews.title: My 4yo LOVES it and its the perfect size. Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was everything we were hoping for! My 4yo LOVES it and its the perfect size. Exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hughes

customer_reviews.title: great toy, but should be a little cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas present and he is 16 months old. He absolutely loves it and it is nice and tall, but the tools are kind of cheap looking and the vacuum really should at least make noise or work! Since it is the deluxe version, it also would have been nice to have more wooden pieces to put together or a few more tools.
customer_reviews.author: Heather LaCourt

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this for my son and he really likes it. It is easy to put together and has a lot of things for him to play with. It could be improved by having some items make noises but it does not have that. However, the drill and the saw that come with it, my son loves. Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: smitchell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Just what I expected except for what appears to be blue "drawers ". They aren't drawers at all, but there is storage behind it. Just disappointed about that. My 3 yo loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my 2 yr old son for christmas of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2 yr old son for christmas of 2015! He loves this and plays with it all the time! There are some small parts so as any parent should the child needs monitoring with the smaller parts!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for a bright young grandson!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Grandson. I was sent a video with him playing with his workshop. Lots of things to keep him busy building things.
customer_reviews.author: MLoo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together lots of great detail. Hours and hours of playtime!
customer_reviews.author: C. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Quality workshop
customer_reviews.text: It was a great birthday gift as our grandson loves to bang things. We put the small pieces away for later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like Daddy and Poppa
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and perfect for my 2 year old grandson. It could be improved by adding a few more interactive tools. Also, by adding some batteries to the shop vac would make the sound of a vacuum more realistic. However, he is very much a boy who loves to make the sounds of toys, be it a truck, a lion, or a vacuum. Hope this review helps those who choose Step 2 products.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: We were pleased with the soft construction pieces and of course
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 3 year old grandson. He was thrilled!! We were pleased with the soft construction pieces and of course, he was was delighted with the drill!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Sobelson

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this! They love be playing with all of ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this! They love be playing with all of the tools and putting the screws in the table. Provides hours of fun
customer_reviews.author: Meghan A Gill

customer_reviews.title: Your son will love it
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and easy to put together. I wish there were more things to build and more ways to use the nuts and bolts, but it's still nice. There are a lot of nuts, bolts, tools, and places to put things. Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very cute.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. My son is 2 and it's probably a little too old for him but maybe in a year or so he will get more out of it
customer_reviews.author: Hadonova

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this workshop. If I could give it a ten I would. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: ladymc

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this work bench. It goes well with all the power tools he has also. It is very sturdy and I see it lasting a long time and passing down to another kid when he out grows it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in the Buckeye State

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my 3-year old!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my 3-year old son. He hasn't quite figured out the pretend wood and building with it but loves the tools, compartments, and the work light!
customer_reviews.author: HandleyMom

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son's 3rd birthday. He loves it! It is a toy he can play with for hours and hours on end! It has a lot of storage, so we were able to store is other too kits in it. My daughter is 9 months and the pieces are big enough that I'm not worried she will choke on them. The nuts and bolts might be a problem, but they are pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe~aholic

customer_reviews.title: Typical Step 2 quality Super Durable. Lots to do and amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Daycare and my Grandsons adore it. Typical Step 2 quality Super Durable. Lots to do and amazing quality. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. The vacuum hose makes it a little bulky since it doesn't fold well and keeps falling, but that's a small thing. My son and his friends get hours of fun from this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clapprood

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow intructions for assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow intructions for assembly, I was able to assemble it alone. Nice size, will be able to grow with my two year old.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Single

customer_reviews.title: Such a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 4 yr old daughter and 2 yr old son for Christmas, and they both love it. It took a while to put together, but they play with it everyday. The hammer and the drill are definitely my son's fav tools, and he loves the little light as well. Such a good purchase; I'm really glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: YknSweetie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this workshop. It's the perfect size and comes with lots of exciting things for them to do with it. He is always carrying the tools around with him when he sees his daddy working around the house. He loves the lamp over the workbench too.

customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old grandson absolutely loves this toy. When my daughter-in-law tells him to get ready to do "whatever" (leave, eat, take a bath), his answer is always... "I working".

customer_reviews.text: Given to our 3 y/o son for Christmas - was a hit then and still is one of his favorite toys! I considered several different workshops and am glad we got this one.

customer_reviews.title: Okay

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it. He enjoys hammering the nails ...
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it. He enjoys hammering the nails into the wood and making the bird house and many other things with the foam pieces. I would get this again if I had to as a gift in the future.

customer_reviews.title: Good Toy to Grow with!
customer_reviews.text: Great workshop for early toddlers, to young child. Lots to do and easy to store tools.

customer_reviews.title: Great Workshop!
customer_reviews.text: This workshop was the big hit of Christmas for my 3 year old. Very comparable quality to other Step2 products we have, exactly as described and expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old loves this, but I have some issues.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this, but I have some issues. The vacuum hose attachment doesn't really fit the hose and you can't screw it down. It just pops off with little effort. This should be so easy to fix. There are no hangers for several of the tools I had to use double-sided tape to hang the overhead light
customer_reviews.author: Clinton D. Hart

product_meta.title: Step2 Deluxe Workshop Playset
product_meta.description: The Deluxe Workshop by Step2 is the ultimate toy tool workshop for a child’s play room. Kiddos will make believe they're a carpenter or designer as they create wooden masterpieces with Durafoam. Children can pretend to be a handyman or handywomen as they use their toy tools to build the ultimate project. This tool workshop for kids is large with plenty of space and accessories for multi-child play. Made in USA of US and imported parts. Adult assembly required.
feature_bullets: Deluxe workbench with large work surface for the little builder who loves to work with their hands
Includes an electric drill, 2 drill bits, 8 screws, 8 nuts, saw, hammer, pliers, adjustable wrench, screw driver and 17 "wood" pieces
Has bins and jars for storage, spring action vise and pretend shop vac
Unique realistic-looking "wood" is made from indestructible Durafoam (Instructions included for 4 projects)
Features tool chest looking cabinet, slide in/out drawer, parts bin and hanging jars for storage and easy clean-up
Has realistic working overhead shop light and battery-operated drill with realistic sounds (Batteries not included)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
